alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 11:23PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Itasca, Aitkin, western Pine, southwestern St. Louis, western Carlton and southwestern Burnett Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Libby, to 6 miles northeast of Cambridge, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rock Creek and Jacobson around 1140 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pine City, Swan River and Warba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and east central Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.
